subject: Positive Audit Outcome: Preventative Detection of Corrosion on Fuselage C
content:
Dear Quality Assurance and Engineering Leadership,

I am submitting this report to highlight a major success in our **Scheduled Inspection Program** based on the findings on **August 3rd, 2025**.

This event is logged as a successful preventative detection under work order **MAINT-AUDIT-20250803-007**.

**Success Details (Equipment: Fuselage C - Cargo Bay Area):**

During a planned deep-cycle inspection of the airframe, the inspection team successfully identified **minor pitting corrosion** on **Fuselage C** near the cargo door sill. Crucially, the discovery was made while the corrosion was still classified as **Level 1 (initial/surface)**, well before it reached critical structural limits. 

**Positive Outcome and Action Taken:**

This early detection is a direct reflection of the **high quality and thoroughness of our inspection teams**. The required procedure was executed immediately:

1.  The affected area was meticulously cleaned and blended out, restoring the surface.
2.  A specialized **anti-corrosion treatment and sealant** were applied, exceeding the minimum repair procedure guidelines.
3.  Adjacent panels were inspected using **Eddy Current testing** (NDT), which confirmed that the corrosion was completely isolated, guaranteeing the long-term structural integrity of the airframe.

**Impact:**

By catching this issue during a routine check, we avoided a much costlier and time-consuming repair had the corrosion progressed. This proactive result demonstrates the excellent value and effectiveness of our current maintenance methodology. The aircraft was returned to service with **zero operational impact** on the flight schedule.

**Contact Information:**

**Aircraft Location:** Fuselage fully closed, Paint Bay complete, Aircraft Ready for Service (RTS).
**Contact Name:** Patricia Kim, Quality Assurance Lead
**Phone:** (555) 555-4444
**Email:** patricia.kim@airmaint.com

Congratulations to the inspection and repair teams for an outstanding job in preserving the asset value and airworthiness of the fleet. This outcome is a testament to our commitment to safety.

Sincerely,
Patricia Kim
Quality Assurance Lead
